name: Theme File Duplicator
author: Jon Schwab

sections.description: Now fully compatible with child themes. Clone an existing template file without uploading new files via FTP. Optionally, a user can add a template name, so that the new file will be automatically recognized as a new page template in the post editor. If using a child theme, the new file will be copied from the parent theme folder into the child theme.
sections.installation:
1. Upload file-duplicator folder to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. Go to Appearance -> Add Page Template
sections.changelog:
1.3

  • New files are now added to STYLESHEETPATH, for compatibility with child themes
  • Only accept valid filenames

1.0

  • Initial release

short_description: Clone an existing template file from the Wordpress admin area. Go to Appearance -> Add Page Template
description: Now fully compatible with child themes. Clone an existing template file without uploading new files via FTP. Optionally, a user can add a template name, so that the new file will be automatically recognized as a new page template in the post editor. If using a child theme, the new file will be copied from the parent theme folder into the child theme.

upgrade_notice.1.3: Strongly recommended. Full support for building child themes.
